result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D Boyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew D Boyer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew D Boyer was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Probation can terminate after 18 months upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from probation agent. Must provide a DNA sample to the State of Wisconsin within 10 days.

timeConds.notes: Stayed. To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew D Boyer in court with attorney Stephen P. Johnson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 2. Court dismisses Ct. 1 outright. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must submit a DNA sample to the State of Wisconsin through the Door County Jail within 10 days and pay the $250 DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make sentencing statement. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/03/14 by Officer Bilodeau. (fingerprint card destroyed 4/03/14)
to Appear and to Enter a Not Guilty Plea

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond set.
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

Defendant Matthew D Boyer in court with attorney Stephen P Johnson.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defendant waives time limit for prelim., wishes to waive the preliminary hearing this morning.  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 08:15 am.
